title: Additional Rescissions of Harmful Executive Orders and Actions

enrichment.summary: This executive order revokes a series of executive orders, memoranda, and presidential determinations issued by the previous administration, aiming to reverse policies considered harmful and to restore a more traditional approach to federal governance. It includes actions affecting public health, labor standards, national security, economic policy, and federal support for tribal nations.
potential_concerns: Revoking the increase in the minimum wage for federal contractors may negatively impact low-income individuals and working-age adults relying on federal contracts for improved pay.
Rescinding pandemic preparedness orders could weaken protections for healthcare workers and public health infrastructure, potentially increasing risks during future health crises.
Eliminating delegations under the Defense Production Act may disrupt supply chain resilience and strain defense industry workers tasked with critical production responsibilities.
Reversing reforms supporting tribal colleges and tribal governments might undermine educational and self-determination advancements for Native American communities.
Curtailing executive actions on apprenticeships and worker empowerment risks slowing progress for union members and working-age adults seeking vocational training and labor rights.
